summary: This document is an email exchange between a Special Agent from the DOJ Office of the Inspector General and another party, discussing the identification of attorneys who represented Jeffrey Epstein and visited him in prison. The response lists defense attorneys who filed appearances in the Epstein case and identifies two individuals who visited Epstein in jail in connection with his will.

events.title: Email Inquiry About Epstein's Attorneys
events.description: A Special Agent from the DOJ OIG New York Field Office sends an email inquiry asking for help identifying attorneys who represented Jeffrey Epstein and visited him in prison, specifically mentioning names 'Colon' and 'G. Tali' from the MCC attorney log.

events.title: Epstein's Jail Visits for Will
events.description: It is reported that Mariel Colon Miro and Gulnora Tali visited Jeffrey Epstein in jail in connection with his will.

locations: One Battery Park Plaza, 29th Floor, New York, NY 10004
keyFacts: Six defense attorneys are officially listed as having filed notices of appearance in the Epstein case: James Brochin, Marc Allan Fernich, Martin Weinberg, Michael Miller, Michael Scavelli, and Reid Weingarten.
Mariel Colon Miro and Gulnora Tali are identified as individuals who visited Jeffrey Epstein in jail in connection with his will, based on publicly available reports.

The inquiry originates from a Special Agent at the U.S. Department of Justice Office of the Inspector General, New York Field Office, indicating ongoing official interest in Epstein's legal representation and jail visits.
The document references the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) attorney log, which was reportedly difficult to read, prompting the request for clarification.
